abstracts.cdata!:
The overall assessment of the project is
            satisfactory, with a highly satisfactory outcome at the
            identification stage. Although the macroeconomic situation
            has improved, economic sustainability is dependent upon a
            continued decline in inflation and real interest rates.
            Further, in line with the Medium Term Expenditure Framework
            (MTEF), resources need to be delivered to ministries, even
            though expenditure restraints are still necessary.
            Therefore, the fiscal program is heavily balanced on tax
            revenue increases, external funding recovery, and, domestic
            interest rates and payments reduction. The possibility of
            another bout of fiscal excess is a major risk to the
            program, coupled with demands for salary increases by public
            servants; but the impetus for structural reforms remains
            strong. The key lessons learned show that with effort and
            cooperation, the Bank is in a position to deliver timely
            assistance quite rapidly, recognized by the identification
            and decision to pursue a fast track operation. Policy
            reforms may often be delayed in a maturing democracy, due to
            the need for consensus build-up; but, in turn, this process
            may well safeguard reforms by forming a coalition and
            building the momentum for change. Additional efforts to
            strengthen the government's ownership in divestiture
            programs, may enhance the effectiveness of adjustment and
            technical assistance instruments.
